answers.answer: Are you just trying to control it with diet? If so there is nothing you can do now.  Keep track of what you ate when it does go up that high, so you can avoid that in the future. The only way to bring  blood sugar down is with insulin.
I've been type 1 diabetic since I was 13. Try walking. A little exercise will lower blood sugar naturally

Yea I control it with diet...don't need med or insulin... My blood sugar is controlled pretty good this is the highest its ever been since I found out that I had gd...but being so high can it affect my baby

Def go for a walk  .. make sure not to eat that again or portion it alil better  .. I also have gd and I'm learning what my body can handle and what spikes me I have to take metformin for it but still get high numbers
My numbers are controlled...so I think I'm doing good in my diet...but today was the first time its been so high so I'm worried if it will affect my baby this one time

High numbers every now and then can happen it shouldn't effect baby but if it's a concern let ur Dr kno what ur number was and get that verified by him/her.. but I think it 9nly effects it it happens constantly

question: I have gd...well I checked my sugar 1 hour after I ate...and it was at 199 what should i do???
title: Please really need answers Gestational diabetes ????
